item.title: Wheelie Bin, 11th October
item.description:
Again with the lone broken (no lid) wheelie bin being left in the middle of the pavement, near the post box, and overflowing. This obviously belongs to one of the residents above the shops. Can they be located and told not to leave their wheelie bin in the middle of the pavement. Also, fix a new lid to the bin to stop overflow and abuse.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): High Street, Beckenham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Lamp Post Unit B3 has been O/S for over a year., 11th October
item.description:
Lamp Post Unit B3 has been O/S for over a year now and requires attention; it also requires some Tree trimming to allow the light to spread out properly, for one thing; and secondly it is too dim for that spot in any case and needs to be a double LED unit, a brighter whiter unit; as they all do along that street. There are so many dingier looking streets all around here you know; I dunno why that is; it used to look proper all around NW8. but it seems to me that since around/about 2020 all the street lights have gotten really sick looking; dim, yellow, weak; just too darn weak looking. Can we not upgrade them back to the way they were before? Anyway, see what you can do, if the council are at all concerned; and I suppose you can only do what you can do; but, please, try for us. Many thanks and kind regards.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 42, Bell Street, Paddington, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Police called to report a Car crash. Damage to three concrete bollards. Remnants of bollards on the carriageway., 10th October
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 82, Wickham Road, Beckenham, London

item.title: Street drainage blocked outside 52 Mainridge Road, BR7 6DW, 10th October
item.description:
The occupants of 52 Mainridge Road employed contractors to clean their weed infested block paving front garden. Unfortunately the contractor has not cleared the waste and allowed it to gather in the street below the kerb Blocking the street drainage.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Mainridge Road, Coldharbour, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rubbish being left in the street by regularly visiting car, 10th October
item.description:
Amount of unhygienic rubbish and bottles being left on the street at the. closed junction of Manor Lane Terrace and Kellerton Road used (unpleasantly) used tissues and rubbish just left on the street after. car White Audi EU63 OOB. parks there two or three times a week from. 1800 hours to 2300 Hours with two people in it doing goodness knows what- You camera at the junction should pick this up - Flytipping and. not very nice - it is a mess
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Kellerton Road, Hither Green, London
Report on FixMyStreet
